intro: Phuodendron ulei, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Phuodendron ulei is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
